goals__remit:
Practising Law Institute (“PLI”) is nonprofit learning organization dedicated to keeping attorneys and professionals at the forefront of knowledge and expertise, as well as preparing them to fulfill their pro bono responsibilities. To accomplish this, PLI provides the highest quality, accredited, continuing legal and professional education programs in a variety of delivery formats. These formats include live programs presented in state-of-the-art facilities, live webcasts, on-demand and via mobile apps.  
 
PLI publishes and updates a comprehensive library of Treatises, Course Handbooks and Answer Books which are easily accessed in print or through PLI’s online searchable database.  
 
Our diverse, volunteer faculty and authors are highly regarded as the leading experts in numerous fields. The collective knowledge of this esteemed group enables PLI to provide programs and publications that support a range of educational needs, from addressing the needs of the new attorney or business professional, as well as the experienced professional.  
 
A cornerstone of PLI’s mission is a long-standing commitment to the pro bono community, which includes an ever-growing number of offerings, many of which are available free of charge or on a scholarship basis. 
 
PLI does not conduct activities directly or indirectly to influence the formulation or implementation of policy and the decision-making processes of the EU institutions.
